primary_diagnosis.justification: Clinical history confirms multiple previous major depressive episodes (recurrent) without history of manic or hypomanic states. The current episode persists despite 4 weeks of *Sertraline* treatment, indicating ongoing, impactful symptoms warranting a moderate severity specifier, as per previous consensus shared by the provider.
dsm_criteria_met: A. Meets criteria for a major depressive episode.
C. No history of manic or hypomanic episodes.
D. Symptoms cause clinically significant distress or impairment.
Recurrence specifier met based on previous documented episodes.

ruled_out.reason: The patient explicitly denies any history of manic or hypomanic episodes, ruling out bipolar spectrum disorders as the primary cause of the depressive symptoms.
The clinical history confirms prior episodes of depression, necessitating the use of the recurrent specifier (F33.x) rather than the single episode specifier (F32.x).
